body.p:
239
Hd Qrs. 3d Ky Cavl
Nashville Tenn
May 1s 1864
King R. H.
Lt Col 3d Cavl

Sends statements of Maj Breathitt and capt A G Slav in relation to interfearance by col Starling and Ware to recruiting from the 35th Ky for the 3 years service and asking you to take action in the matter.

8 inclosures
Rcd A G. O. 6" May 1864

Head Quarters Ky. Vols.
Adjutant General's Office.
Frankfort-Ky. May 6th 1864

By order of His Excellency- Gov. Bramlette, this subject is respectfully refered to Brig. Gen. Burbridge The attempt to recruit was under authority from this office granted, under orders from the War Dept. which were solicited by the twelve months troops and not by the State. The contempt shown to the authority of both the State and General Governments, in these repeated hinderances by officers of twelve months regiments- induces Gov. Bramlette, to lay the whole matter before the U.S. Authorities -- as the regiments are not under State control and to ask that, if guilty, these officers be punished.

Respectfully &c
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen of Ky.
